question_text: Why are only three 20 MHz channels in the 2.4 GHz band considered non-overlapping in most countries?
answer_options: The 2.4 GHz band only allows three channels total
All other channels are restricted by licensing
The limited spectrum causes adjacent channels to overlap
Wi-Fi clients can only support three simultaneous streams
correct_answer: The limited spectrum causes adjacent channels to overlap
explanation: Because the 2.4 GHz band is narrow, most 20 MHz channels overlap with adjacent ones, leaving only channels 1, 6, and 11 non-overlapping in practice.
